4.title: Get Smart
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: In Hell
1.plot: Meet Charlie Madison - small-time Los Angeles PI, fugitive from justice, recovering alcoholic... our hero. Charlie starts off the first episode of the series forgetting exactly where he is, and ends it forgetting the cardinal rule for any man trying to lay low while his extensive legal troubles blow over -- never do illegal surveillance work for someone you don't know.

2.title: The Job
2.plot: Charlie gets details from Gary about his supposedly wayward fiancée, Tamara Jenkins. Desperate for cash, and against his better judgment, Charlie agrees to Gary's terms, and even after a drug-fueled encounter with the Tremont Tavern bartender calls into question Gary's entire story, Madison can't help but chase down what appears to be a relatively easy and harmless score.

3.title: The Body
3.plot: Sure, he's financially flush for the first time in weeks, but Charlie can't shake the nagging feeling that something about Gary stinks. He finds Tamara Jenkins, working as a coolly professional owner of a south side Art Gallery, as cryptic as she is beautiful; and later that night, he makes the shocking discovery that tells him he's in much hotter water than he ever could have suspected.

4.title: Holding On
4.plot: When confronting Gary with what he knows about the previous night's homicide yields only an icy dismissal, Charlie is desperate for an honest soul to connect with. That turns out to be Doris, a regular at Charlie's recovery meeting and a sober member for over 21 years. Whether her effort to reach out is strong enough to keep him sober is another matter altogether - one which he'll soon be hard pressed to ignore.

5.title: The Visit
5.plot: Los Angeles Assistant DA Timothy Simpson is in Chattanooga for business, not pleasure. He feeds Detective Phipps, a local homicide detective assigned to the bartenders case, some information from an anonymous tip that he hopes will land Madison in custody. If Charlie can keep his head on straight and out of the bottle, he might be able to think his way out of his sticky situation but thats a pretty big if.

6.title: Happy Birthday
6.plot: Apparently, it's Charlies one-year sober birthday, so he honors the occasion with a cake, a candle, and a heartfelt expression of his honest gratitude to his fellow drunks in recovery. What follows isn't exactly what the program might recommend. Tamara proves herself to be the dangerous player Charlie always suspected she was, and a haunting memory at the end of his long night knocks him out cold.

7.title: Falling Further
7.plot: Phipps starts taking a keen interest in this interloper from Los Angeles that Simpson told him about, and confronts Charlie with some pointed questions about his whereabouts on the night of the bartenders murder. Scared as hell, Charlie turns to one, then another member of his recovery group for guidance and help. But his presence on Doris front porch is no more welcome than it is in the city limits by the Chattanooga detective.

8.title: The Bartender
8.plot: The life of a drug-dealing bartender without a car is complicated. You start your day diluting product and getting high. You walk to your supplier to pay off and re-up. You drop where you've been told to, you stash where you think is safe, and you get to work in time to start your shift. Maybe you end your day with some light reading. And the knock at your apartment door could be the last one you ever hear.

9.title: Ride Home
9.plot: After strangely taking a chip for 90 days sober shortly after celebrating his 1-year birthday, Charlie decides to give Doris' son Jorge a ride home. It turns out to be a mistake that drives Doris into a vicious rage, while Simpson's attempt to prod Phipps into an investigation of Charlie appears to have hit a dead end.

10.title: Coming Clean
10.plot: Charlie meets Phipps in a surreptitious location in the dead of night, and their conversation hints at an underhanded collusion that defies the normal rules of surveillance and law enforcement. Later, confronting him on a dock alongside the Tennessee River, Doris asks for some straight talk from the troubled fugitive, and Charlie's emotional attempt to answer her drives Season 1 to its breathtaking climax.

3.title: A Dirty Game

imdb.plot outline: The Steps is a noir mystery web series about Charlie Madison, a lowlife private investigator from Los Angeles who attempts to live under an assumed identity in middle America to escape his criminal past, and ends up in even hotter water than he was before he left. A key player in the blackmailing enterprise of Dante Pelinsano (based on the infamous "P.I. to the Stars" Anthony Pellicano), Charlie has to split Hollywood when the Assistant D.A. who put Dante in prison seems to determined to take him down as well. His attempt to lay low in the quiet, mid-sized city of Chattanooga, Tennessee would be a lot easier if he weren't a recovering alcoholic who, left to his own devices, quickly sinks into a self-destructive drunken depression. Forced to socialize with the locals at recovery meetings, and desperate for a little income, Charlie takes a wiretapping job that seems harmless enough, but soon has him in the crosshairs of 2 separate murder investigations. The noose tightens, the authorities from both cities close in, his personal relationships fray at the edges, and whether or not Charlie can pull himself out of his desperate tailspin becomes the question at the heart of this popular web thriller.
imdb.title: The Steps

A key player in the blackmailing enterprise of Dante Pelinsano (based on the infamous "P.I. to the Stars" Anthony Pellicano), Charlie has to split Hollywood when the Assistant D.A. who put Dante in prison seems to determined to take him down as well. His attempt to lay low in the quiet, mid-sized city of Chattanooga, Tennessee would be a lot easier if he weren't a recovering alcoholic who, left to his own devices, quickly sinks into a self-destructive drunken depression. Forced to socialize with the locals at recovery meetings, and desperate for a little income, Charlie takes a wiretapping job that seems harmless enough, but soon has him in the crosshairs of 2 separate murder investigations. The noose tightens, the authorities from both cities close in, his personal relationships fray at the edges, and whether or not Charlie can pull himself out of his desperate tailspin becomes the question at the heart of this popular web thriller.::Dylan Kussman
